resource_data:
<expression xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0 http://fire.eun.org/lode/imslorsltitm_v1p0.xsd" xmlns="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
  <identifier>
    <catalog>hdl</catalog>
    <entry>10494/105917</entry>
  </identifier>
  <identifier>
    <catalog>expression-cmr-id</catalog>
    <entry>105917</entry>
  </identifier>
  <description>
    <facet>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.expressionDescriptionFacetValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>main</value>
    </facet>
    <metadata>
      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1770206989</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en">The Hare and the Water: A Tanzanian Folktale</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Die Hasen und das Wasser: Ein Tanzanian 
Folktale</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Les lièvres et l'eau : Un Folktale 
Tanzanien</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Os hare e a água: Um Tanzanian Folktale</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Le lepri e l'acqua: Un Tanzanian Folktale</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Οι λαγοί και το ύδωρ: Ένα τανζανικό Folktale</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Las liebres y el agua: Un Tanzanian Folktale</string>
          </title>
          <description>
            <string language="en">helps students explore the literary elements of a Tanzanian folktale, connect its message to contemporary Tanzanian life, create original conclusions, and thematically illustrate the folktale using oil pastels.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Social Sciences</string>
          </keyword>
          <language>en</language>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Hilfen Kursteilnehmer erforschen die literarischen 
Elemente eines Tanzanian folktale, schließen seine Meldung an 
zeitgenössische Tanzanian Lebensdauer an, erstellen ursprüngliche 
Zusammenfassungen und veranschaulichen thematically das folktale mit 
Ölpastellen.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">les étudiants d'aides explorent les éléments 
littéraires d'un folktale tanzanien, relient son message à la vie 
tanzanienne contemporaine, créent des conclusions initiales, et 
illustrent thematically le folktale en utilisant des pastels d'huile.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">os estudantes das ajudas exploram os elementos 
literários de um folktale de Tanzanian, conectam sua mensagem à vida
contemporary de Tanzanian, críam conclusões originais, e ilustram 
thematically o folktale usando pastels do óleo.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">gli allievi di aiuti esplorano gli elementi 
letterari di un folktale di Tanzanian, collegano il relativo messaggio
a vita contemporanea di Tanzanian, creano le conclusioni originali e 
thematically illustrano il folktale usando i pastelli dell'olio.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">βοηθά τους σπουδαστές να ερευνήσουν τα λογοτεχνικά 
στοιχεία ενός τανζανικού folktale, συνδέει το μήνυμά του με 
τη σύγχρονη τανζανική ζωή, δημιουργεί τα αρχικά συμπεράσματα, 
και επεξηγεί θεματικά το folktale χρησιμοποιώντας τις 
κρητιδογραφίες πετρελαίου.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">los estudiantes de las ayudas exploran los 
elementos literarios de un folktale de Tanzanian, conectan su mensaje 
con la vida contemporánea de Tanzanian, crean conclusiones 
originales, y thematically ilustran el folktale usando pasteles del 
aceite.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Sozialwissenschaften</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Les Sciences Sociales</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Ciências Sociais</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Scienze Sociali</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Κοινωνικές επιστήμες</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Ciencias Sociales</string>
          </keyword>
        </general>
        <metaMetadata>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1770206989</entry>
          </identifier>
          <language>en</language>
        </metaMetadata>
        <educational>
          <language>en</language>
        </educational>
        <rights>
          <copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
            <source>copyrightAndOtherRestrictionsValues</source>
            <value>yes</value>
          </copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
          <description>
            <string language="en">Custom License</string>
          </description>
        </rights>
      </lom>
    </metadata>
  </description>
  <manifestation>
    <identifier>
      <catalog>manifestation-cmr-id</catalog>
      <entry>105917</entry>
    </identifier>
    <name>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.manifestationNameValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>experience</value>
    </name>
    <item>
      <location>
        <uri>http://www.oercommons.org/courses/the-hare-and-the-water-a-tanzanian-folktale</uri>
      </location>
    </item>
  </manifestation>
</expression>
